Steps to reproduce:

Compose a message with multiple paragraphs that each need more then one line. Insert at the end of one line in one of the paragraphs and enter (return).


Actual results:

Visually the same text is there because no wrapping needs to occurs. It is not clear to the composer of the message that this enter is inserted, be it on purpose or an error.


Expected results:

Sligthly highlight the current paragraph in grey so that unwanted or wanted line breaks are visible. See screenshots in attachements for reference.
